content.title: Clopidogrel (P2Y12 Inhibitor)
content.definition: Thienopyridine prodrug antiplatelet agent that irreversibly inhibits P2Y12 ADP receptor on platelets.

concepts.definition: Prodrug requiring hepatic CYP2C19 activation to active metabolite that irreversibly binds P2Y12 receptor.
Loading and maintenance dosing for various vascular indications.

clinical_features.acs: 600 mg load, 75 mg daily for 12 months

concepts.definition: Variable antiplatelet response due to genetic and drug factors.
Role of clopidogrel in vascular surgery patients.

clinical_features.carotid_stent: DAPT for minimum 30 days, ideally 3-6 months

clinical_features.testing: CYP2C19 genotyping or platelet function testing in high-risk
